intro: Disterigma mayanum, commonly known as the Mayan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, while its flowers are usually blue or purple, attracting various pollinators. Disterigma mayanum is also known for its edible fruits, which are similar in appearance to those of the common thornapple.
